title: Loot privelage taken away because of power outage
body: I recently have had power outage due to the weather and have posted a forum on the bug for the 20 minute prequeue turning out to be well over an hour just to wait for a game. i went through my punishment on that even with the bug on the lpq making me wait well over an HOUR just before a game. this has happened two days in a row and now im ineligible to recieve loot. someone wanna tell me why im ineligible to recieve loot because of this and how long this will last. Extremely frustrated at these occurrences considering  none of which was my fault, but yet im being punished on a multitude of levels.

replies.body:
Do you always talk shit about teammates, while standing in the fountain, while you have a power outage?

You AFK'ed 3 games in a row.

In the 3rd game, you blame internet. If it was a power outage, how was your internet bad?

1.) Why did you keep playing, instead of waiting until your internet was good.
2.) How were you able to still type while the power was out?
3.) How was your internet able to function at all without power?

I've been in conflict with suddenlink about the internet. As you may know, it is winter and there is snow outside in some places around the country. If you've ever experienced these things, you of all people should know... sometimes your power will go out and come back on. its quite a miracle to be honest. Some people arent that fortunate and their power will not come back on, in this case i was fortunate for my power to come back on. Now for the internet, yes it is a sad thing to have the company at your house 4 times in a month.. especially when they claim to have gotten it fixed. I've now been through 2 new modems and I'm on a new router with expectancy of maintenance man to come back here on Friday. They're claiming now it might be faulty wiring from the telephone poll to my house. With that being said, Internet was claimed to be fixed so of coarse i will attempt to play, but as said with faulty wiring my connection will be shot for a short period of time and then come back online like nothing ever happened.

> If you've ever experienced these things, you of all people should know... sometimes your power will go out and come back on.

Originally from MN. Can confirm, never lost internet from snow. My hair used to also freeze completely solid while waiting for the bus. I've had eyelashes snap off. I know places that aren't used to snow can have issues.

If you suspect internet issues, try out the hextech repair tool:

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367-Automated-Troubleshooting-Hextech-Repair-Tool

If you are having issues, I'd suggest not playing until they are resolved.

I can however see that in the first AFK, you were upset at your team and said you were going to afk. You also wished that someone on your team would end up in the hospital. Those 3 games looked like a roller coaster of tilt. When that happens, even without internet problems, take some time off. No point in playing a game that is supposed to be fun if you're just getting angry about it. Having internet issues on top of that is going to most certainly create a frustrating experience for you, others, and you will additionally have to do with penalties that result.

As i imagine you can see though, the power outage was during my zilean game, the two teemo games was because of internet. Also im sure you can note that the last teemo game we had a mf afk and bard that had to leave. trying to conclude the game so nobody would be under such punishment of afk, which led to trying to ff. So I recieve the punishment of no loot instead of chat ban or something ? seems acceptable. Please fix you're pre-queue bug aswell. Thank you.

Regardless, my point stands. The purpose of the job is not to "shit on" people who lie about their punishments. It is simply to correct the record and ensure that Riot is not falsely portrayed to the public.

Additionally, it is dangerous to encourage a culture of got-em's. As much as we disapprove of the posters for lying about their punishments, they are still people with things they fear, love, or care about. They have favorite foods, they sleep and dream, they use the restroom. It becomes easy to forget that they are human and easy to treat them as less than that. Don't fall into that pattern.

Y'know, I've been browsing these forums over the past few days, and it seems every time Tantram comes and sheds light on confusion or brings the OP's lies to light, you're always piggybacking with some sarcastic comment and feigned sympathies to whoever got "smote".

Yeah, I don't participate in the "smite" bandwagon. Besides, you talk like that small part of the community is something to emulate. It really isn't.

And, I'm really loathe to invoke the [Boards Universal Rules](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/4LgZ2EwM-universal-rules) against something that up until now I haven't really bothered reporting, but, here goes;

> **The Golden Rule**
>
> Always be respectful to players, community members, moderators, and Rioters. Harassment and insults will not be tolerated (“just playing” is NOT a catch-all excuse).

For one, piggybacking "smites" by going "LOL REKT" or - worse in your case - making a sarcastic comment about the OP in a separate comment string - is again, very disrespectful, and it almost certainly turns what's normally a Rioter's elucidation on a player's problem into a game of virtual "throw apples at the guy in the stocks".

> _Spamming / Trolling_
>
> Here is a breakdown of the various types of spam / trolling that we look for:
> - _**Posting content not related to the discussion**_
> - Posting a discussion or comment across multiple sub-boards
> - Posting designed to bait conversation or falsify content
> - _**Making repetitive non-constructive or low effort content**_
> - Bumping of discussions with no additional context
> - **_Excessive emoji / icon spam_**
> - Necromancy of any discussion over 1 month old

Bolded and italicized the three common sins of the "smite" bandwagon.

Posting content not related to the discussion (all it is really is just screaming hype over someone 'getting told', which isn't related to the discussion at all.), making repetitive, non-constructive/low effort content (it takes literally nothing to say "LOL REKT" and, again, it adds _nothing_ to the discussion.), and (in some cases, thankfully not your own, but it's still present on this post), excessive emoji/icon spam. (One {{summoner:11}} alone is one too many on the PB boards, as it were.)

---

So, yeah. Really shouldn't be on that "smite" bandwagon, period. It's disrespectful, unnecessary, and it's generally against the rules. And since you chose to emulate the people doing it, you're going to have to do what I did when I first found out about report-calling being reportable and unnecessary: Un-learn it.

So, from here on out, I'm genuinely going to report anyone who takes it upon themselves to piggyback "smites". It doesn't belong on this board, and I absolutely agree with you: If I want to see change, I'm going to have to be it.

This is actually a very sound and reasonable point. I have only done a few smite replies, but I think I am going to be getting off that wagon, now. Continue with the good logics, my good sir/ma'am!
